intro: Tassadia decaisneana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Tassadia decaisneana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
